intro: Scabiosa subpubescens, commonly known as the downy scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and clusters of pink to purple flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Scabiosa subpubescens is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
